intro: Dapania scandens, commonly known as the climbing dapania, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems that often twine around supports, and its small, white to pale yellow flowers that appear in umbrella-like clusters. The plant has finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. Dapania scandens is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and subtle floral display.
